definition: to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.chinese: 他的笑话有些牵强附会。

sentences.english: The novel has a very contrived plot.
sentences.chinese: 这本小说有非常牵强附会的情节。

sentences.english: That's not as far-fetched as it sounds.

definition: to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
